reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate of parasomnia prevalence (5% global population) summing major subtypes: sleepwalking (~1-4%), night terrors (~2-3%), nightmares (~2-8%), REM sleep behavior disorder (~1-2%), other parasomnias (<1%). Reported as prevalence (existing cases) rather than incidence, as parasomnias are chronic/recurring conditions not typically measured by new diagnoses. Low confidence due to heterogeneity, variable definitions across studies, and limited population-based epidemiological data for the aggregate category.
